;History of the Place - Croatia has been inhabited considering that the Stone Age. The Croats arrived in the seventh century in what is Croatia today. The first king, Tomislav I was crowned in Advert 925 and Croatia grew to become a Kingdom. The Kingdom of Croatia retained its sovereignty for nearly two centuries. Croatia entered a union with Hungary in 1102. In 1526, the Croatian Parliament elected Ferdinand from the House of Habsburg to the Croatian throne. In 1918 Croatia declared independence from Austria-Hungary and joined the Kingdom of Yugoslavia. During Globe War II, the Germans occupied Croatian territory and designed the Independent State of Croatia. Soon after the war Croatia became a founding member of the 2nd Yugoslavia. On June 25, 1991, in the course of a bloody civil war, Croatia declared independence and grew to become a sovereign state.
